p: The use of different mulches has gained increased importance for moisture conservation, weed management and improve soil nutrients [ 48– 52]. The use of plant-based mulches not only lowers cost incurred on crop production, but also solves residue management issue. Nonetheless, mulches did not pose negative impact to crop production; therefore, can be successfully used for weed management [ 53, 54]. Sorghum [ Sorghum bicolor (L.) Moench] is an important allelopathic crop and have been reported to suppress seed germination and seedling emergence of several weed species in different crops [ 55– 60]. However, the impact of sorghum mulches on seedling emergence of X. strumarium has merely been tested.
